quote: China has welcomed the defeat of Taiwan’s pro-independence ruling Democratic Progressive party (DPP) at local elections, saying it showed people wanted peaceful relations with Beijing.
title: Taiwan votes down same-sex marriage as China welcomes midterm results
title_tw: 台灣公投拒絕同婚；中國樂見期中選舉結果

quote:
Ein Sieg für Peking

Dass dieses Referendum nicht zu Stande kam, dürfte nicht zuletzt Peking freuen. Die Volksrepublik hatte vor Konsequenzen gewarnt, wenn Taiwan versuchen würde, den olympischen Namenskompromiss von 1981 zu ändern. Peking betrachtet Taiwan als Teil seines Territoriums und missbilligt alles, was auf eine Eigenständigkeit oder Unabhängigkeit der Insel hindeutet.

Auch das starke Abschneiden der KMT ist ganz im Sinne der kommunistischen Machthaber auf dem Festland. Denn die KMT hatte unter Präsident Ma Ying-jeou zwischen 2008 und 2016 eine Politik der Annäherung an China verfolgt, die unter Präsidentin Tsai zum Erliegen gekommen ist. Peking hat in den vergangene zwei Jahren massiv Druck auf die Regierung Tsai ausgeübt, etwa indem es westliche Unternehmen dazu gezwungen hat, «Taiwan, China» als Bezeichnung für die Insel zu verwenden.
title: Taiwans Regierungspartei fährt eine schwere Wahlschlappe ein
title_tw: 台灣執政黨面對選舉重大挫敗

quote: But the majority of voters want to maintain the status quo - neither independence nor unification. They simply want good relations with China and peace and prosperity for Taiwan. If President Tsai and her party refuse to change course on China, they risk losing the presidency and their majority rule in parliament in the 2020 election.
title: Taiwan voters reject same-sex marriage in referendums
title_tw: 台灣人公投拒絕同婚

quote: The president of Taiwan resigned as leader of her party Saturday night after it suffered stunning local election defeats to the opposition Kuomintang, which favors closer ties with China.
title: Taiwan’s President Quits as Party Chief After Stinging Losses in Local Races
title_tw: 地方選舉慘敗，台灣總統辭黨魁

quote: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen announced on Saturday plans to step down as party chairwoman following sweeping midterm losses against a rival party that favors closer relations with China.
title: Taiwanese president quits party leadership after pro-China rivals claim ballot landslide
title_tw: 親中對手獲全勝，台灣總統辭黨魁

quote: Taiwanese also elected candidates from the China-friendly opposition Nationalist Party to a majority of mayoral and county magistrate posts, reversing the party’s losses in 2014.
title: Taiwanese reject legalizing same-sex unions in referendum
title_tw: 台灣人公投拒絕同婚合法化

quote: The local elections have been regarded as the most pivotal political test for the ruling party, as not only more than 10,000 local officials will be appointed – including the mayors of the six special municipalities of Taipei, New Taipei, Taoyuan, Taichung, Tainan and Kaohsiung – but also the sensitive relationship between the Chinese mainland and Taiwan, and contact between the U.S. and Taiwan will be heavily reshaped. Most importantly, the polls will bode ill or well for the sitting leader's re-election chances in two years.
title: Opinion: Taiwan’s political turnaround shows people’s will
title_tw: 觀點：政治大轉彎，台灣人民展現意志

quote:
Taking the initiative to quit her job as chair of the DPP, Tsai, who had exhausted her means to beg for United States’ protection and endorsement, must have also realized it is not only her economic policies, but also her separatism that has lost the Taiwan people’s hearts, and the US’ agenda-setting ability on the island’s politics has markedly degraded.

Either the Taiwan people or the White House thinks more of their own respective interests, which in the first place hinges on peaceful and stable cross-Straits relations. But the Tsai administration, which has gone in the opposite direction, turning itself to be a betrayal of Taiwan’s interests and a troublemaker to its allegedly most important ally, has drifted farther away from the practical needs of the Taiwan people, and the historical trends of recognizing the “one China” consensus.
title: Taiwan leader lost people’s hearts: China Daily editorial
title_tw: 中國日報社論：台灣領導人失去民心

quote: The elections for mayors and thousands of local posts are seen as a key test for the 2-year-old administration of Tsai, whom Beijing has relentlessly attacked over her refusal to endorse its claim that Taiwan is a part of China.
title: The Latest: Taiwan president resigns as head of ruling party
title_tw: 最新：台灣總統辭執政黨魁

quote: China resents Tsai for her refusal to endorse its stance that the self-governing island democracy is a part of the Chinese nation. But the Nationalists won just six of the mayoral and magistrate seats in the 2014 local races as voters rejected their close ties with China. Tsai went on to beat the Nationalist candidate for president.
title: Taiwan votes in local elections amid pressure from China
title_tw: 中國壓力籠罩台灣地方選舉

quote: Taiwanese will vote Saturday in midterm local elections that are seen as a test for the ruling party and a referendum on the island’s chilly relations with China, which has ramped up pressure on Taiwan to abandon any thought of independence.
title: Taiwan elections seen as a referendum on the island’s icy relationship with China
title_tw: 台灣選舉是對中國關係的公投

quote: Another referendum will tackle the island’s official competition name in the Olypmic Games. Taiwan currently competes as “Chinese Taipei” at international sporting events under a 1979 International Olympic Committee resolution. Voters will now have a chance to change that. If approved, the country will compete as Taiwan.
title: Taiwan heads to polls to vote on Olympic name change, same-sex marriage
title_tw: 台灣公投奧運代表隊更名、同性婚姻

quote: Ahead of the vote, there has been an avalanche of advertisements in Taiwanese media. Conservative groups have been accused of spreading misinformation about LGBT rights, running homophobic advertisements ahead of videos aimed at children on YouTube and using chat apps such as Line to spread false rumors stating that same-sex marriage will prompt a wave of HIV-positive gay men to move to Taiwan to take advantage of the island’s health-care system.
title: Taiwan was supposed to be the first place in Asia to legalize gay marriage. Then things got complicated.
title_tw: 台灣原應是亞洲第一同婚合法化的地方，但事情沒那麼單純

title: ‘A great divide’: Inside the battle to stop same-sex marriage in Taiwan
title_tw: 台灣大分歧：阻止同婚的戰爭內幕

quote: Voters in Taiwan have delivered a strong rebuke to the island’s pro-independence ruling party in local elections, emboldening the China-friendly opposition, one of whose main figures says he will now reach out to Beijing to forge more friendly ties.
title: Taiwan rebukes ruling party, emboldens China-friendly opposition
title_tw: 台灣人不認同執政黨，親中勢力壯大

quote: The people of Taiwan have been taking part Saturday in local elections — an event that people across the Taiwan Strait in the People’s Republic of China (PRC) can only dream of. The vote is taking place amid widespread worries about interference from Beijing, which appears to have organized a full-scale disinformation campaign to undermine the current government of President Tsai Ing-wen and support political forces who favor closer ties with the mainland.
title: Here’s what the Chinese Communist Party wants you to forget about Taiwan
title_tw: 中國共產黨想讓你忘記台灣

quote: The local elections, as well as a failed referendum on whether the island’s Olympic athletes would compete under the name “Taiwan,” were both seen as bellwether contests for public support on independence.
title: Taiwan President resigns as head of party after losses in local elections
title_tw: 地方選舉失敗，台灣總統辭黨魁

title: Inside story: Will Taiwan vote’s outcome bring China friendly party?
title_tw: 深入觀點：台灣選舉結果讓親中政黨壯大？

quote: Candidates of the main opposition Nationalist Party, or Kuomintang (KMT), were leading in half of the mayoral elections held Saturday in six special municipal districts across Taiwan, preliminary results show, a development certain to please Beijing.
title: Candidates of pro-China KMT lead in several Taiwan mayoral elections
title_tw: 親中中國國民黨候選人於台灣市長選舉領先

quote:
Redan före valet skickade KMT en delegation till Peking för att arbeta för ett närmande, ett drag Peking har tagit emot med öppna armar samtidigt som de inte har velat ha direktkontakt med Tsai Ing-Wens regering. Stärkta av valresultatet har KMT fortsatt sin Kinaflört.

– Taiwan mår bara bra om relationerna över Taiwansundet mår bra, säger Han Kuo-Yu, partiets nyvalde borgmästare i Taiwans näst största stad Kaohsiung, enligt Reuters.

Han har tidigare gjort sig känd för ett uttalande om att Taiwans självständighet är mer skrämmande än syfilis.

Utöver regionvalen folkomröstade taiwaneserna i tio olika frågor, även där gick mycket emot DPP. Partiet låg bakom ett förslag om samkönade äktenskap, vilket röstades ner. De reformvänliga förlorade även den symboliskt mycket viktiga omröstningen om vad landet ska kalla sig vid OS i Tokyo 2020. Folket röstade för att fortsätta kalla sig “Kinesiska Taipei” i stället för föreslagna “Taiwan”.
title: Regeringskaos hotar splittrat Taiwan
title_tw: 治理危機威脅分裂台灣

title: Wahlschlappe für Regierungspartei in Taiwan
title_tw: 台灣執政黨選舉失勢

quote: Naast het uitbrengen van hun oordeel over het homohuwelijk, kozen de Taiwanezen zaterdag ook nieuwe burgemeesters. De regeringspartij Democratische Progressieve Partij (DPP) leed daarbij een aantal pijnlijke nederlagen. De burgemeesterschappen van de tweede stad van het land, Taichung, en het belangrijke kiesdistrict Kaohsiung gingen na twee decennia over op de pro-Chinese oppositiepartij Kuomintang.
title: Taiwan stemt tegen homohuwelijk, verkiezingsnederlaag regeringspartij
title_tw: 台灣選舉拒絕同婚，執政黨敗選

quote: Sinds de DPP in 2016 aan de macht kwam, verslechterden de verhoudingen met China. President Tsai hamert voortdurend op de onafhankelijkheid van Taiwan, wat slecht valt in Peking.
title: Regeringspartij Taiwan krijgt klappen bij lokale verkiezingen
title_tw: 地方選舉重創台灣執政黨

quote: De president Tsai Ing-wen van de Democratische Progressieve Partij (DPP) heeft haar nederlaag erkend in de lokale verkiezingen en kondigde direct erna aan af te treden als voorzitter van de partij. De DPP is groot voorstander van onafhankelijkheid van China. Toen Tsai in 2016 de verkiezingen won verbrak China alle banden met het land. Ondertussen begon China wel in steeds sterkere mate politieke en economische druk uit te oefenen op Taiwan. Met succes, lijkt het, omdat de steun voor de DPP onder de bevolking nu is geslonken van een meerderheid tot ongeveer een derde.
title: Taiwanezen stemmen tegen homohuwelijk in referendum
title_tw: 台灣公投拒絕同婚

title: Taiwanezen straffen president – ze willen géén afstand tot China
title_tw: 台灣人不想與中國疏遠，懲罰總統

quote:
Tsai has framed the local elections as a way to ‘tell the world’ that Taiwan will not bow to Beijing, which has ramped up military and diplomatic pressure since she took office in 2016.

China sees self-ruling Taiwan as part of its territory and is incensed that Tsai will not acknowledge the island as part of ‘one China’, unlike her predecessor Ma Ying-jeou of the Beijing-friendly Kuomintang party (KMT).
title: Taiwan vote spotlights social and political rifts
title_tw: 台灣選舉顯示社會政治分歧

title: La opción progresista se hunde en las elecciones locales de Taiwan
title_tw: 台灣地方選舉擊沈進步價值

quote: La victòria aquest dissabte de l’opositor Partit Kuomintang (KMT) en les eleccions locals de Taiwan suposa un dur revés per a l’actual govern independentista per l’aposta de l’electorat a millorar els vincles amb la Xina. L’any vinent hi ha comicis presidencials, així que els resultats s’han llegit en clau de primera volta, tot i que no es preveu un canvi radical en les relacions entre Taipei i Pequín més enllà de petits gestos d’apropament.
title: Els pro-xinesos guanyen a les eleccions locals de Taiwan
title_tw: 親中勢力贏得台灣地方選舉

quote: Una sconfitta che rivela l’insoddisfazione per il deteriorarsi dei rapporti con la Cina, che considera Taiwan come parte integrante del proprio territorio. Prima donna a diventare presidente, Tsai Ing-wen aveva presentato le elezioni come un modo per “dire al mondo” che Taiwan non si inchinerà mai a Pechino, nonostante le sue accresciute pressioni militari e diplomatiche nella regione.
title: Taiwan, pesante sconfitta del partito di governo a elezioni locali
title_tw: 台灣地方選舉，執政黨慘敗

quote: C’est très important évidemment, car cette vague bleue partie du sud de l’île, pourrait être un prélude à la présidentielle de 2020, un scrutin suivi de près à Pékin. La présidente taiwanaise a parlé d’interférences chinoises dans la campagne. Depuis son arrivée au pouvoir, Pékin et Taipei ne se parlent plus, le KMT pro-chinois, en a d’ailleurs fait un argument de campagne accusant cette mauvaise entente avec Pékin, de nuire à l’économie.
title: Elections locales à Taiwan: le parti au pouvoir en net recul
title_tw: 台灣地方選舉：執政黨重挫

quote: Les électeurs taïwanais ont infligé samedi une défaite cinglante au parti au pouvoir lors d’élections locales, conduisant la présidente Tsai Ing-wen à quitter la direction de sa formation, alors que l’opposition, plus encline à des compromis avec la Chine, a progressé.
title: Elections locales à Taiwan: défaite du parti au pouvoir
title_tw: 台灣地方選舉：執政黨敗選

quote:
Bei den Wahlen errang die größte Oppositionspartei, die Peking-freundliche Kuomintang (KMT), nach eigenen Angaben die Mehrheit. Die DPP fuhr deutliche Verluste ein und verlor erstmals seit 20 Jahren auch ihre traditionelle Hochburg Kaohsiung.

Die Wahlen galten als Stimmungstest für die Staatschefin. Tsai, die seit 2016 Präsidentin ist, gilt als energische Verfechterin der Unabhängigkeit des Landes. Nach ihrem Wahlsieg hatte sie China ausdrücklich vor einer „Unterdrückung“ Taiwans gewarnt.
title: Taiwan stimmt in Referenden gegen Homo-Ehe
title_tw: 台灣公投拒絕同婚

quote: The vote against changing the name used in international sporting events to Taiwan was seen as a test of support for independence. It was symbolic in nature, as the International Olympic Committee had ruled out a name change, which would be opposed by China.
title: Taiwan ruling party suffers major defeat in local elections
title_tw: 台灣執政黨於地方選舉大敗

title: Taiwan voters reject same-sex marriage
title_tw: 台灣人投票拒絕同婚

quote: China blij met verkiezingen Taiwan
title: China blij met verkiezingen Taiwan
title_tw: 中國對台灣選舉感到開心

quote: China blij met uitslag verkiezingen Taiwan
title: China blij met uitslag verkiezingen Taiwan
title_tw: 中國對台灣選舉感到開心

quote: Parallelamente la popolazione ha inflitto una dura sconfitta al partito progressista della presidente Tsai Ing-wen, in varie elezioni locali. La donna, che ha già lasciato la presidenza della sua formazione, vede ora le speranze di una sua rielezione compromesse. L’opposizione, più incline al compromesso con Pechino registra invece un netto aumento dei consensi. Questo, va peraltro sottolineato, in un contesto di accresciute pressioni politiche cinesi.
title: Progressisti sconfitti a Taiwan
title_tw: 進步主義者在台灣的失敗

quote:
Kuomintang schlug Demokratische Fortschrittspartei

Bei den gleichzeitig stattgefundenen Kommunalwahlen setzten sich mit der Kuomintang die nationalkonservativen Kreise der Traditionspartei Kuomintang gegen die liberale Demokratische Fortschrittspartei durch. Während die Kuomintang für eine Annäherung an das kommunistische China plädiert, fährt die Demokratische Fortschrittspartei einen strikten Eigenständigkeitskurs gegen Peking.

Dies ist insofern interessant, als die Kuomintang, seinerzeit gegründet unter dem späteren taiwanesischen Staatspräsidenten Tschiang Kai-schek, eigentlich eine ursprünglich antikommunistische Bewegung war, deren Anhänger nach der Machtübernahme von Mao 1949 nach Taiwan geflüchtet waren.
title: Volksabstimmung auf Taiwan: Homo-Ehe gekippt
title_tw: 台灣公投：同婚翻盤

title: Democratic Progressive Party suffers big defeat in Taiwan elections; Tsai Ing-wen resigns as chairwoman
title_tw: 民主進步黨台灣選舉重大挫敗；蔡英文辭黨魁

quote: The Beijing-friendly main opposition Kuomintang (KMT) made gains in the face of China’s increasing pressure on the island.
title: China’s allies thrash Taiwan’s Tsai in midterm election
title_tw: 台灣期中選舉：中國盟友鞭打蔡英文

title: Taiwan’s progressive image takes hit after divisive polls
title_tw: 地方選舉讓台灣進步形象重挫

title: Taiwan ruling party suffers major defeat in local elections
title_tw: 台灣執政黨於地方選舉大敗

quote: 기존 팀명인 차이니스 타이베이에서 차이니스를 없애고 대만의 이름을 찾자는 이번 시도는 사실상 중국으로부터의 독립 의지를 묻는 성격이 강했다. 그러나 다수의 대만인은 현상유지를 택한 것이다.
title: 대만 올림픽팀명 ‘차이니스 타이베이’ 유지…탈원전도 ‘부결’

title_tw: 台灣公投拒絕奧運更名，維持「中華台北」

quote: Bonnie Glaser, senior adviser for Asia at the Washington-based Centre for Strategic and International Studies, told Fairfax Media she didn’t agree with claims the election result, and the potential for a change in government in Taiwan in 2020, would create difficulties between Taipei and Washington.
title: Taiwan president Tsai resigns as party chair after election losses
title_tw: 選舉失敗，台灣蔡總統辭黨魁

quote: China says the electoral defeat for Taiwan’s President shows the ‘attempts of Taiwan independence are doomed to fail’.
title: China lauds voters after defeat of Taiwan's ruling party
title_tw: 台灣執政黨選舉失敗，中國嗆聲

quote: Sin paliativos. El Gobierno chinoescéptico de la presidenta de Taiwán Tsai Ing-wen ha sufrido este sábado una durísima derrota en unas elecciones municipales que se planteaban como un anticipo de las presidenciales en poco más de un año. Tras perder los principales Ayuntamientos de la isla, incluida la ciudad bastión de su partido, el Demócrata Progresista (DPP), la jefa de Estado ha dimitido como líder de esta formación política. El gran vencedor de la jornada es el partido Kuomintang (KMT), más partidario de cultivar lazos amistosos con Pekín, que considera a la isla parte inalienable de su territorio.
title: Duro golpe electoral para los partidarios de la independencia de Taiwán de China
title_tw: 台灣獨立支持者遭遇重大選舉失敗

quote: Le parti indépendantiste de la présidente a connu une vive défaite aux élections locales face au candidat favorable au rapprochement avec la Chine.
title: Nouvelle donne politique à Taïwan après la déroute du parti au pouvoir
title_tw: 執政黨失敗，台灣政治新局

quote: Le Kuomintang (KMT), principal parti d’opposition considéré comme plus enclin au compromis avec Pékin, a enregistré de nets progrès dans un contexte de pressions accrues de la Chine.
title: Gifle électorale pour le camp progressiste à Taïwan
title_tw: 選舉打臉台灣進步陣營

quote: L’échec du parti pro-indépendantiste au pouvoir lors d’élections locales à Taïwan a conduit samedi la présidente Tsai Ing-wen à quitter la direction de sa formation. Le parti d’opposition Kuomintang, plus enclin à des compromis avec Pékin, progresse.
title: Le parti pro-indépendantiste au pouvoir à Taïwan battu lors des élections locales

quote: A Taïwan, des élections sous influence chinoise
title: A Taïwan, des élections sous influence chinoise
title_tw: 中國影響台灣選舉

quote: “This result demands a response from Tsai, and the obvious change would be to emphasize the DPP’s strengths and the things that got Tsai in,” said Jonathan Sullivan, director of Nottingham University’s China Policy Institute. “Tsai has made a liberal, progressive society a big part of her appeals to the rest of the world to support Taiwan in juxtaposition to an increasingly repressive China.”
title: Pro-China Party's Big Win in Taiwan Puts Tsai Future in Doubt
title_tw: 在台親中政黨大勝，蔡前途遭質疑

quote: Taiwan’s ruling Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) has suffered punishing losses in local elections in a boost for the China-friendly opposition, while voters also rejected plans to legalise same-sex marriage and a proposal to change the name of its Olympic team to Taiwan from the current Chinese Taipei.
title: Election losses for Taiwan’s ruling party lift pro-China opposition
title_tw: 台灣執政黨選舉失敗，親中勢力壯大

quote: De Taiwanese kiezer lonkt naar China
title: De Taiwanese kiezer lonkt naar China
title_tw: 台灣選民向中國招手

quote: China said the results reflected “the strong will of the public” for closer Taiwan-Chinese relations.
title: Taiwanese ruling party suffers local election defeats
title_tw: 台灣執政黨選舉失敗

title: Taiwan nægter homoseksuelle ægteskab
title_tw: 台灣拒絕同婚

quote: Tsai’s party suffered heavy losses in local elections to the China-friendly opposition, raising questions about her prospects in the general election in January 2020. Voters rejected a proposal for Taiwan to compete in international sports events, including the 2020 Olympics, as “Taiwan” rather than “Chinese Taipei” — a title it’s used since 1981. Analysts saw the voter backlash as a response to domestic issues such as labor reforms rather than Tsai’s dealings with China.
title: Taiwan’s Tightrope
title_tw: 台灣走鋼索

quote: The big winner in Taiwan’s weekend elections? China
title: The big winner in Taiwan's weekend elections? China
title_tw: 台灣選舉最大贏家？中國

quote: “This result demands a response from Tsai, and the obvious change would be to emphasize the DPP’s strengths and the things that got Tsai in,” said Jonathan Sullivan, director of Nottingham University’s China Policy Institute. “Tsai has made a liberal, progressive society a big part of her appeals to the rest of the world to support Taiwan in juxtaposition to an increasingly repressive China.”
title: Pro-China party’s big win in Taiwan puts Tsai future in doubt
title_tw: 親中政黨大勝，蔡前途遭質疑

quote: Chinese state media heaped pressure on Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen on Monday after her ruling pro-independence party suffered heavy defeats at local elections at the weekend, saying Beijing would seek cooperation with newly elected officials.
title: China heaps pressure on Taiwan president after election defeat
title_tw: 選舉失敗，中國對台灣總統加強施壓

quote: The election results have introduced a high degree of uncertainty in cross-strait relations and the US-Taiwan security calculus
title: Shock Taiwan local elections result casts doubt over China policy
title_tw: 台灣地方選舉驚人結果，中國政策遭質疑

quote: The results of the polls, being held just over a year before Taiwan’s next presidential election, are likely to please China, which claims self-ruled and proudly democratic Taiwan as its own and has ramped up pressure on Ms Tsai and her administration since she took office in 2016.
title: Taiwan mid-terms: Electorate turns away from ruling Democratic Progressive Party
title_tw: 台灣期中選舉：選民背離執政的民主進步黨

quote: Local elections in Taiwan went poorly for the ruling party on Saturday (Nov. 24). But in China, Beijing has been given much to celebrate.
title: Taiwan’s elections have given Beijing much to celebrate
title_tw: 北京歡慶台灣選舉結果

quote: In Taiwan, the DPP’s loss is China's gain and a setback for the US
title: In Taiwan, the DPP’s loss is China’s gain and a setback for the US
title_tw: 台灣民主進步黨失敗，中國得利，美國失利

quote: “The [election] results reflected the strong will of the Taiwan public in hoping to continue to share the benefits of the peaceful development of relations across the Taiwan Strait, and their strong wish in hoping to improve the island’s economy and people’s wellbeing,” said a statement by China’s policy-making Taiwan Affairs Office and carried by state media.
title: Taiwan votes down same-sex marriage as China welcomes midterm results
title_tw: 選民拒絕同婚，中國歡迎台灣期中選舉結果

quote: The leader has pushed for more independence from Beijing, which greeted the election results as a sign the Taiwanese people want closer ties with the mainland.
title: Taiwan President Resigns Party Leadership After Election Defeats
title_tw: 選舉失敗，台灣總統辭黨魁

quote: Taiwan is expected to remain a major flashpoint for China and the US despite the election defeat of the independence-leaning ruling party over the weekend.
